abstract: Commerce Department reports consumer spending rose 0.4 percent in August, after revised rise of 0.4 percent in July; reports personal income rose 0.3 percent in August.
lead_paragraph: The report could help convince investors that the economy was strong enough to warrant a rate increase this year, as the Fed has indicated.

headline.main: In a Bullish Sign, Consumer Spending Jumps in August
headline.print_headline: Consumer Spending Jumps, in a Bullish Sign for Economic Growth

snippet: The report could help convince investors that the economy was strong enough to warrant a rate increase this year, as the Fed has indicated.
